column1: 4px;line-height:1.3"">A US District Court judge ruled that state law gave Governor Charlie Baker's administration “broad discretion” in terminating the-then head of the Commission for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing after it investigated his ties to a fraternity where members wore robes resembling Ku Klux Klan garb.
